name: Armenia
description: Armenia, a landlocked country in the South Caucasus, boasts a rich history, stunning landscapes, and unique cultural heritage. Situated at the crossroads of Europe and Asia, Armenia has been shaped by ancient empires, religious traditions, and dramatic geological forces. From snow-capped mountains to fertile valleys, and ancient monasteries to vibrant cities, Armenia offers a diverse and unforgettable travel experience.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The vibrant capital city, a blend of ancient and modern architecture.
quickFacts.detail: Yerevan is known for its numerous parks, museums, and bustling cafes.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population identifies as ethnic Armenians.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: A language with a history spanning millennia.
quickFacts.detail: Armenian is an independent branch of the Indo-European language family.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The exchange rate fluctuates, but generally around 450 AMD per 1 USD.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A relatively small but incredibly diverse country.
quickFacts.detail: Armenia is one of the smallest countries in the world.

quickFacts.label: Elevation
quickFacts.description: Home to the highest peak in the Lesser Caucasus.
quickFacts.detail: Mount Aragats dominates the landscape and offers challenging hiking opportunities.

climateData.title: Armenian Climate
climateData.description: Armenia experiences a humid subtropical climate in the lowlands, transitioning to a continental climate in the highlands.  Summers are warm and sunny, while winters are cold and snowy, particularly in the mountainous regions. Rainfall is distributed throughout the year, with higher amounts in the spring and autumn.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March-May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A time of rebirth and blossoming, with wildflowers carpeting the hillsides.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June-August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Warm and sunny days, ideal for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September-November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Crisp air and stunning autumn foliage, a beautiful time for exploring.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December-February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Cold and snowy conditions, perfect for winter sports.

naturalWonders.name: Lake Sevan
naturalWonders.description: Armenia’s largest lake, a vital source of freshwater and a stunning natural landmark. Surrounded by monasteries and picturesque villages.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Lake Sevan is a high-altitude lake, known for its unique ecosystem and the traditional 'sevan' fish. It’s a crucial water resource for the country.
viewingTips: Visit the monasteries along the shore

naturalWonders.name: Geghard Monastery
naturalWonders.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, carved into the cliffs of Armenia’s volcanic mountains. A testament to the country’s rich religious history.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Geghard is renowned for its intricate carvings and its role as a repository for the Holy Cross relic. It’s a complex of cave churches and monastic buildings.
viewingTips: Explore the different levels of the monastery

naturalWonders.name: Mount Aragats
naturalWonders.description: Armenia’s highest peak, offering breathtaking panoramic views and challenging hiking trails. A sacred mountain for Armenians.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Mount Aragats is a dormant volcano and a significant geological feature. It’s a popular destination for mountaineering and offers diverse ecosystems.

ecosystemData.title: Armenian Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Armenia’s diverse ecosystems range from alpine meadows and coniferous forests to semi-desert landscapes and wetlands. The country’s unique geography and climate contribute to a rich biodiversity.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mammals
biodiversityCategories.description: Armenia is home to a variety of mammals, including the Armenian wolf, brown bear, and lynx.

biodiversityCategories.name: Birds
biodiversityCategories.description: Armenia is a birdwatcher’s paradise, with over 300 bird species recorded.

statistics.details: Diverse species of eagles and falcons

activities.description: Armenia offers a wide range of activities for all interests, from hiking and trekking to cultural experiences and adventure sports.
